comments.content: It may be a font but this one is fully customized...look at few characters like "R"z, "O"z and "C"z. Both "K"z in the word clockwork are different...no?

It's a bit like Baby teeth, but I think this is custom.  
You can find some more alternatives in this thread  
 [http://typophile.com/node/28494](http://web.archive.org/web/20110317142813/http:/typophile.com/node/28494 "http://typophile.com/node/28494")

If something similar will do for you:

Michael Hagemann (Fontmesa) based his Timepiece font  
 [http://www.dafont.com/timepiece.font](http://web.archive.org/web/20110317142813/http:/www.dafont.com/timepiece.font "http://www.dafont.com/timepiece.font")

on this Clockwork Orange logo  
 [http://www.x-entertainment.com/articles/0275/](http://web.archive.org/web/20110317142813/http:/www.x-entertainment.com/articles/0275/ "http://www.x-entertainment.com/articles/0275/")

The logo can also be found in EPS-format on [http://www.brandsoftheworld.com/search/?query\_id=3342458&page=1&mtype=&b...](http://web.archive.org/web/20110317142813/http:/www.brandsoftheworld.com/search/?query_id=3342458&page=1&mtype=&brand_id=145315 "http://www.brandsoftheworld.com/search/?query\_id=3342458&page=1&mtype=&brand\_id=145315")
